campaign.story:
Introducing Gamma, the ultimate all-climate jacket. Gamma Jacket is a durable, lightweight, insulated jacket that doesn’t compromise function or fashion. Building on graphene's amazing properties, Gamma is your everyday jacket, your travel jacket, your activewear, and your going-out jacket. 

Back us today and discover why Gamma is the only layer you'll ever need whether you're hiking the Koʻolau ranges in Hawaii or skiing in the Swiss Alps or biking to work.
Whether you are hiking in the mountains or popping into town for a coffee, the heat-insulating design will warm you up in a matter of seconds. Gamma is the only jacket you’ll need all year round, all around the globe.
Graphene is what makes Gamma unlike any other activewear. Graphene is a nano-lattice - just one atom thick, yet it’s stronger than diamond. Known as “supreme graphene” for its long list of properties and benefits, graphene is the thinnest, strongest, and most flexible known material.
By infusing a graphene layer into the Gamma Jacket, we were able to create a new kind of outerwear. Gamma functions as a winter jacket, a cool-weather jacket, a windbreaker, a rain jacket, and activewear all at once.
While traditional synthetic insulation is the standard, it’s nowhere near the level of warmth that a graphene-infused jacket has. Gamma takes graphene-integrated clothing to a whole new level of modern sustainability and style. Lightweight, all-seasonal, strong, and breathable.
Graphene’s thermal properties have been called revolutionary. It is able to adapt to your body almost like a second skin. Graphene moves heat through its latticed structure, evenly distributing it around your body. In warm weather, it expels heat and wicks moisture to keep you cool.
Graphene conducts heat from your body and Gamma’s built-in heaters and channels it throughout the jacket. In cold weather, it evenly distributes heat to your entire upper-body. In hot weather, it expels heat through its permeable pores.
With Gamma, you won’t have to wear multiple layers or bulky coats. Gamma’s graphene layer will regulate its temperature based on your environment, so you’ll stay comfortable in temperatures from warm to frigid.

From city strolls to hikes to snowsports, Gamma will keep you at your ideal temperature.
Gamma is equipped with 3 carbon fiber heating elements built directly into the jacket. When your body heat isn’t enough, you can supercharge Gamma’s graphene layer at the push of a button.

Within seconds, the heaters will begin to warm the jacket, and graphene will distribute the heat to your entire upper-body. Graphene’s thermoregulating properties also ensure the jacket won’t become too hot.

Gamma’s built-in heaters will keep you warm and comfortable even in sub-zero conditions. No need for more layers, even on the coldest days.

Gamma’s heaters are powered by any power bank. Just plug it into the USB-A input in the inner pocket and the jacket will begin to heat up.
Combined with graphene's thermoregulating properties, unlike other materials, Gamma will never overheat or ignite. Even if you leave the heater on or fall asleep in the jacket, there is no risk of burns or overheating.

Gamma's built in heater comes with 3 adjustable temperature settings that you can cycle through with the press of a button to help fight every kind of cold!
These are estimates tested in ideal conditions and may not be precise as various conditions including temperature, your power bank's efficiency, etc. may affect the final achievable time.
The carbon fiber heating elements won’t restrict your movement or weigh you down. Because the jacket doesn’t contain any electrical parts or batteries, you can machine wash it without the risk of damage.
Gamma contains many pockets, including several hidden pockets, making it practical at home and safe while traveling. Anything you used to stuff in your tote bag can now be stored in your jacket.
Head to the campground, office, or airport with everything you need close to your body with Gamma's secure pockets.  

Gamma’s fit is fully adjustable to ensure your comfort and to protect you from the elements, whenever you need it.
Adjustable drawstrings in the hood and waist lock in heat and protect against wind. 
Velcro cuffs and a high neck secure your wrists and guard sensitive skin.
Built-in fingerless gloves to protect your hands without hindering your grip.
  Tired of heavy jackets and puffy layers?

Gamma is the solution. Graphene isn’t just the strongest known material. It’s also the thinnest. At one atom thick, it’s lighter than air—literally. This makes Gamma incredibly lightweight and flexible—perfect for folding, storing, packing, and shoving in your backpack. Traveling with Gamma can save heaps of space in your luggage, especially for minimalist backpackers.
Note: as we continue development and prototyping, Gamma's final weight may either increase or decrease as we build out our final product and fabric mix. 
Gamma weighs as much as the average hoodie. Yet, it can keep you warm as well as a thick winter coat.
Graphene, a material stronger than diamond, can resist almost all forms of damage. It's scratch-proof, puncture-proof, tear-proof, and abrasion-proof. Feel safe in Gamma knowing you can wear it in the toughest conditions.
Gamma resists surface wear caused by rubbing or scratching, resisting scuffing or tear. You can expect Gamma to still look like fresh and new after years of heavy use.
Note: Gamma has not been tested / certified to be bulletproof, cut-proof, or knife-proof and should never be used as a safety device. We also do not recommend as a complete replacement over a certified motorcycle jacket as it does not have padding or shielding. 
Graphene is able to expel heat without letting cold air inside the jacket, so you’ll never feel that sticky, sweaty feeling you get from most shells, rain jackets, and winter coats.
Graphene’s semipermeable structure also makes Gamma the ideal jacket for warmer weather in autumn and spring. Gamma will keep you cool when the sun comes out by releasing excess heat—graphene knows when to do this by detecting and reacting to your body temperature.
If you’re using Gamma as sportswear, graphene will pull heat and moisture away from your body, moving it to the outer surface of the jacket and expelling it into the air. When you’re on the slopes, jogging, or ice skating, Gamma will keep you feeling cool while maintaining your core temperature.
Don’t worry about working up a sweat in Gamma. Graphene is 100% anti-odor, meaning no odor-causing contaminants can grow on the jacket.

Graphene interacts with sweat odors and neutralizes the smell through ionic conduction, efficiently removing bad smells and neutralizing any harmful substances on its surface.
With Gamma, never worry about your jacket smelling like sweat.
Gamma was built for unforgiving alpine conditions. Combining the naturally wind resistant and water resistant nature of Graphene's compact atomic bonds and our proprietary weave, Gamma is waterproof and windproof. 
Whether you’re strolling in a light mist or stuck in a monsoon, you can count on Gamma to keep you dry and warm.
Even though Gamma is lightweight and thin, its graphene infused technology is effective up to 50 Miles per hour / 80 Kilometers per hour winds.  Gamma is an absolute must whether you're just road biking or doing some high altitude skiing or hiking.

Did you know that harmful UV rays can penetrate many light jackets, windbreakers, and raincoats? This can cause burns and skin damage when outdoors for long periods.  Gamma is UV-proof and keeps your skin safe from the sun when you're outdoors. 
Graphene repels UV light, also helping you to stay cool in the sun. 
Gamma is designed and sized for a comfortable yet slim look. The tailored fit is neither too loose or too tight, creating high flexibility for the wearer. 

All our sizing and designs are unisex so your sizing may not map. Make sure to take measurements. Sizing will be selected at the end of the crowdfunding campaign through surveys.
We charge no restocking fee for size exchanges, but customer must ship the product to us at their own expense. Depending on reshipped address, we may pass on part of the cost of reshipping up to $15-25 USD. Jacket must come back unwashed and in brand-new condition with no visible scuffs, marks, or discolorations. 
The story of Wear Graphene started back in 2004, when graphene was first discovered. Graphene was such a monumental discovery — the strongest and thinnest material on Earth — that it earned its discoverers a Nobel Prize.

About 10 years later, scientists first began to understand how to incorporate graphene into fabric. 

This is where we come in. Our team is composed of young visionaries that want to make a change in the world by innovating new products using cutting edge materials. Our team believes that high fashion and technology can be combined to bring smart clothing to the next level.

But we knew that with graphene, our smart clothing would do more. It’s also anti-odor, UV-proof, waterproof, wind-proof, damage-proof, and so much more. It’s the most versatile and high-performance jacket ever made. And we think it looks pretty cool too.

 The Gamma! We have to fast forward to show you all the features and pockets in one go!
PLAY

Until recently, we have focused our marketing for Gamma in Asia. Now, we would like to grow our presence overseas, starting on Kickstarter to “kickstart” our brand globally. Our existing supply chains and processes will allow us to manufacture and fulfill your order quickly.

We hope that you share our passion for smart and sustainable clothing and choose to become a backer of Gamma Jacket!

Wear Graphene is a Hong Kong-based team of scientists, designers, and business people who are dedicated to changing the way you wear clothes. With a focus on innovating through technology and sustainability, our team has developed a completely new type of graphene-infused smart clothing that we’re very proud of.

The team is excited to launch our first product to a global market with Gamma Jacket.  
This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $300MM through crowdfunding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have had ample experience in design, manufacturing, and sales in the past. We believe we will be able to successfully fulfill Gamma once the campaign ends. However, we do acknowledge that we have not had ample crowdfunding experience and realize that there may be unexpected challenges down the road.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Made with graphene- infused technology, GAMMA will last you for years to come!

updates.update_content:
Thank you all so much! We have some so far in these past 60 days. We have more than 7000 backers from dozens of countries and nearly $2.5M USD in pledges. We've said this so many times throughout our regular updates, messages, comments, and emails, but thank you all so much for your support.

Failed / Errored Payments

Wow, we can't believe there's less than 24 hours left for the journey of a lifetime for our team. With your support we have reached nearly $2.5M USD in pre-orders. For those worried about manufacturing capabilities and capacity, please rest assured during the campaign we have been staying in communications with our suppliers, backup suppliers, and backup-backup suppliers to stay in tune with their situation. We are still confident in their capacity and believe we will be able to fulfill in time.

updates.update_userinfo: Kickstarter Project We Love Feature + $2M USD + 3 Days Left
updates.update_content:
Happy Monday everyone!

We are excited to announce that we have been featured by Kickstarter as a "Project We Love" this morning!

While it may not mean a lot to our backers, for our team who has poured their blood and sweat into this project for months and months, it's incredibly rewarding to see this validation.

Hello everyone,

We hope you all had a great weekend, wherever in the world you are! This past weekend in China and Hong Kong it was May Day! It's also known as Labor Day / International Workers' Day worldwide. For our team it was a good time for us to take a short break as we prepare for a busy next few weeks as our campaign wraps up. We apologize if we missed any messages or comments during this time and will get to it ASAP!

Hello everyone! 

With everyone's support we've hit some mindblowing metrics in the past 30 days:
5000 jackets pre-ordered
Customers from 30+ countries and 100+ cities all around the world
Top 5 most crowdfunded jacket on Kickstarter, EVER!

updates.update_userinfo: Nearly $1M USD! Prototyping and Review Videos Coming In!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,

Thank you all for your support again this past week! We can't even believe it, but it feels like we're nearing the $1M threshold which we could have done without all your support. We do not take your support lightly! Our team has been busy working overtime to keep up with all your comments and queries and have been hard at work prototyping and expanding our product line based on customer feedback.

updates.update_userinfo: Exceeding goals and beyond! Fill out your surveys to share your opinions on product improvements and help us plan for production!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
Thank you all for your support thus far! We're ecstatic that we've raised nearly $450k at this point in the update from more than a thousand backers all around the world.

Please make sure to answer the surveys when you can. For some backers, we are asking for feedback on potential features, up-sells, and colors! We want to hear your opinion on how to improve the Gamma and what other graphene products you might be interested in.

comments.content: I'm backer #58 and you guys said the expectations are to ship in July so I shouldn't have received the survey?
Hi! have you sent a survey? Cause I havent received anything, the last one was "60 Days Later!" Thanks in advance!
Yes! I filled that one already. Thank you so much
Correction: hope we are NOT being scammed!
Just happy to see a response to peoples questions. That relieves psychological anxiety for many backers! Ok, good luck with the surveys and distribution.
Hi. Any news about the development of the project?
Hey guys we are now in June and you say that you are shipping next month so it would be good to get an update post campaign close. No pressure just excited to get the jacket
Okay thanks
When can i Give my informations for shipping and my size
When they send the backer survey. It will come.
They haven’t sent surveys as far as I know. You would put it on there.

Michael, howdy! Many thanks for taking the time to let me know this. We are very excited about this coat, especially for walking on the pristine, empty beaches of Uruguay in winter (June/July/August), so we look forward to getting them soon. CHEERS TO EVERYONE in this "Gamma Family Group"!)
I see. Thanks. Looks like I'm not one of those guys yet.
Months? Estimated Delivery was Jul 2021
Two months? Does that mean you're doing all the manufacturing first, then asking what sizes folks want? Seems a bit backwards to me.
Good question! Following 😊
oh! can you tell us what models of the jackets you tried? I will make sure to try the same ones on in one of the stores.

Yeah thats normal. According to there lasted Update #7, they said that the survey will go up in July. For more info check the full update: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/weargraphene/gamma-all-season-graphene-infused-heated-jacket/posts/3196617
i was about to ask the same question! thanks for being ahead and clearing my doubts!

I ma new in kickstarter, so please help me to get this jacket. I log in, pay by my credit card, now I received that it was declined, I have not found the payment. This is my story. So question is - how can I order the jacket?? Is it still possible?
Read the Updates
Hope this helps :)
I'm a backer & didn't get a chance to do the survey in time so I was wondering if there was any other way to sort the sizing and shipment
That was only a preliminary survey a proper survey with sizing and shipping details will come as part of the pledge manager later

Hi if i remember correctly they said that the jacket isnt in any way fireproof (not tested) because it is made from polyester and nylon. I think for the jacket is the same as for others, if possible be as far away as possible ;)

Sounds good! But the devil is always in the detail. What is the percentage of your graphene fiber relative to polyester and nylon? It also seems that quality of graphene varies quite a bit on the market. How would you rate yours?

I'm getting a message saying that you have collected my pledge, but there is no evidence that any attempt has been made to take payment. The payment certainly hasn't been refused. Have I missed something?
Kickstarter takes a few days to collect all of the pledges. You'll be notified if the payment fails, and you'll have the opportunity to correct the issue.
Thats what I'm gonna do :)
Sizing is very similar to North Face for reference, if you have something from there you can compare sizes that way.
I had asked about that a couple weeks ago and they had stated that wouldn't work for their production timeline unfortunately

Dinesh75 we have similar measurements but I was thinking closer to medium... That is what I wear in North Face sizes. The model that they used in their presentation was a large, but you and I are probably just a bit slimmer. Anyone else with thoughts on sizes?
I'm torn between a small and extra small woman. I'm very petite, and based on the measurements I'd be an XS, but they said to go up a size. I just don't want it so big and bulky its unwearable.
Could part of it be trying to transfer between USD and HKD? Currency conversion could be problematic for your card.
Change your passwords.
Congratulations on running a successful campaign! 🎉👏🎉👏

That would be...unlikely. Creators won't get access to the users payment information at all. That's the only information they are getting: https://www.kickstarter.com/privacy#information-thats-shared-with-creators

campaign.story:
In this video we show how the Smell Inspector distinguish coffee!
Today machines can see, hear, feel and even learn. But smell? Not really! 
Smell Inspector is a developer’s kit and ready-to-use electronic nose gadget in one. For anyone working on smart systems - from developers or scientists to tinkerers. Immediately usable for manufacturers who want to control their production environment and the quality of their products.
Smell inspector is a digital nose, which works with the same principle as a human nose. Train it and create your own specific use case for single gases, gas mixtures or smells.

Components
Smell Inspector
The gadget contains Smell Board iX16×4 with four Smell iX16 detectors, can be connected to a PC, tablet or smartphone and can be operated with the Smell Annotator software. Compatible with Arduino and Raspberry Pi.
Smell Board iX16x4
Electronic board with four Smell iX16 detector chips, providing full functionality to read signals from all 64 individual detectors every 1.8 s and send them out in ASCII format. Can be integrated into different mobile or stationary appliances. 
Smell iX16
This is our core invention: The first multi-channel gas detector chip designed to conquer the mass market. The sensor elements contain fine-tuned carbon nanomaterials which make the chip highly sensitive, small, energy efficient and affordable. There are four Smell iX16 detector chips on the electronic board. The current version has 64 detectors (16 channels per detector chip) with a size of less than 1sqmm (0.08sqinch) each. Further miniaturization and / or increasing the number of detectors can easily be done. The detector chip Smell iX16 only needs 1 µW of power supply. It can thus be powered by various host devices, energy harvesters or batteries. Smell iX16 is designed for use in unlimited miniaturized electronic and IoT applications in various areas. The detector chip has a high sensitivity to different gases and VOCs.
Smell Annotator
Smell Annotator is an AI based software used to detect, annotate and digitize smells with the Smell Inspector as well as to recognize annotated smells. Digital smell patterns are produced by 64 independent gas detectors. Through artificial intelligence our technology learns to recognise particular smells. This can be compared to the way information is processed in our olfactory system. Smell is initially collected and analysed in the olfactory bulb. For recognition and remembering the cortical brain areas get involved. This evolves over our whole lifetime with more and more „data“ processed. The same principle is realized in the Smell Inspector supported with the Smell Annotator software which uses machine learning algorithms.Currently, Windows and Linux systems are supported. Android and iOS will follow.
Goals
Introduce an innovative product with a disruptive technology to the market
Offer a low cost embedded platform for smell detection and recognition
Provide companies with a great tool for fast prototyping of products related to smell
Enable engineers, researchers, designers, makers, tinkerers, software developers… to create new products and services in relation to smell
Give a boost to the maker´s world / DIY community
Build up a worldwide developer’s community for smell related applications
Create a world’s largest digital smell database
Single Pack: Pick a single Smell Inspector Developer's Kit to build your unique smell-related application and start the digital smell revolution.
Explorer Set: Connect to your friends, makers, developers, scientists and choose your Explorer Set to invent great smell-related applications and products in a common, open and creative lab environment. To keep you going, we supply you with an extra set of iX16 Detector chips straight away.
Education Package: Order this for your students in maths, informatics and natural sciences, and provide them with a great tool for their school or university projects.
Shipping and Customs Clearance
We pay the shipping costs for you! Larger packs are more efficient – you can help us by finding a friend to back the Smell Inspector with you! The only additional costs that you need to carry is the customer's clearance fee, which will automatically be fixed by your country's customs. Within the European Union Customs Union (EUCU) there is no customs fee!

Stretch Goals
If we reach those funding levels together, we commit to deliver the following:
Smell Annotator for Mostly Wanted Applications: We extend our pre-set data collection to include smells for the most requested community application. This can be done by one additional engineer to be employed.
LOCKED: Stretch goal reached at: €100,000 (about $121,500)

Smell Annotator Open Access Digital Smell Database: We are building an open access database to which we add measurements from our community. The measurements are checked by us in advance. This can be done by one additional software engineer to be employed.
LOCKED: Stretch goal reached at: €200,000 (about $243,000)
Smell Inspector:
Dimensions: 166 x 64 x 31 mm / 6.54 x 2.52 x 1.22 inch (LxWxH)
Power consumption: max. 0.28 W
Weight: 130 g / 0.29 lb
Materials: Smell Board iX16x4, housing
  Smell Board iX16x4:
Dimensions: 157 x 40 mm and 67 x 50 mm / 6.18 x 1.58 inch and 2.64 x 1.97 (LxW)
Power consumption: max. 0.28 W
Weight: 45 g / 0.1 lb
Materials: 4 Smell iX16 detector chipss, 2 PCBs
Read-out time: all 64 channels every 1.8 s
Read-out format: ASCII
Serial interface
Compatibility: Compatible with Arduino and Raspberry Pi
  Smell iX16:
Dimensions: 22 x 8 mm / 0.87 x 0.32 inch (LxW)
Power consumption: 1 μW
Weight: 0.1 g / 0.0002 lb
Materials: 16 chemiresistor-type nanomaterial based gas detectors, Kapton foil, particle filter
Temperature: 0°C to +40°C / 32°F to +104°F
Sensitivity: High sensitivity to different gases and VOCs (<80 ppb for NH3, PH3, H2S)
  Smell Annotator:
Smell recognition
Smell digitalization and annotation
Visualization of measurements
Saving measurements and loading saved data
Data format: CSV
  *The information provided herein is subject to change without notice.

Compatibility / Connectivity 
"Maximum Flexibility in Smell Recognition and Connectivity"

Smell Annotator Environment
Our analytic software Smell Annotator is supplied with Smell Inspector. It can be used to view, annotate and store measurements of the Smell Inspector. In all cases you will get life access to data from all 64 gas detector channels simultaneously. Smell recognition based on our pre-set data collection will be available for a limited set of smells and gases. Smell Annotator is a development tool! Extend your smell data collection and teach your Smell Inspector to recognize new fragrances and their compositions! Currently, Windows and Linux systems are supported. Android and iOS will follow. Alternatively, you may run and test your own AI based software. 
Arduino ™ and Raspberry Pi ™
Smell Inspector is compatible with sketches, tutorials and resources available for the Arduino and Raspberry Pi community as well as all the shields, sensors and actuators for Arduino and Raspberry Pi DUE available on the market. You can thus build a new tool or combine it with an already existing setup.
DIY - With Smell Inspector you can easily build your own smell-related application
Want to build a bad trash alert, an onion detector or examine the air in your living environment? Smell Inspector allows you to create lots of smell related projects and share them with the community. Combining the flexibility of Arduino ™ or Raspberry Pi ™ with the power of AI based software, you can create lots of smell related solutions.
Implementation - You can integrate the Smell Inspector or just the Smell Board iX16x4 into lots of devices
Smell Board iX16x4 can sniff out dangerous gases and detect  leaks in hazardous environments. The Smell Board iX16x4 weights 45 g, works stably on a flying drone and by sending comprehensive information on its environment every 1.8 seconds, correctly detects the gases despite working propellers. The technology already enables the identification of ammonia and hydrogen sulfide gas sources. The sensor is also currently being trained for other hazardous gases and VOCs.
Prototyping - With the Smell Inspector companies can build high level prototypes in order to detect singles gases, gas mixtures and smells in a fast and easy way
Smell Inspector provides companies with a powerful tool to create fast prototyping for lots of smell related use cases. Smell Inspector allows development engineers, researchers, designers working for companies to quickly create and explore new smell environments in the prototyping phases of a project. In future, Smell iX16 detector chips can be ordered in large amounts directly from SmartNanotubes Technology.

Behind the scenes: a simple smell detection experiment
PLAY

Our team presents how smells can be detected and recognized using the Smell Inspector together with our software Smell Annotator.

“What would you build having a Smell Inspector at hand?”

Use Cases
Thanks to its unique properties Smell iX16 and Smell Inspector can be used across multiple industries. Use cases range from environmental and security applications, home and industrial safety to wearables and IoT lifestyle products. The multi-channel gas detector chip Smell iX16 can be easily integrated into different appliances.
Material: VOCs and off-gassing detection 
Food: aroma profiling, food safety, food consistency and quality
Substances: production monitoring
Transport: drugs and explosives detection
Consumer Goods: toxic or hazardous VOCs detection
Manufacturing: integrated line monitoring for work and product safety 
Environment: air quality measurement
Household: indoor air quality and ventilation control 
Industry: monitoring of outgassing behavior of materials, work safety

Community
Our aim is to create around the Smell Inspector a seamless professional community involving makers, designers, researchers and corporate developers that will grow according to the challenges posed by the new emerging technologies (e.g. Internet of things, cloud computing, cluster computing, etc.) and with the development of novel scent related applications. Quite an ambitious goal, right?
We will support the community by means of handwritten and video based tutorials about interesting experiments, import of digital smell patterns into the Smell Annotator database and will enable and support the community to do the same with their smell data. Furthermore we will be an ongoing partner for the academic world to continuously discover new use cases and facilitate further technological development. As a central community player we are a partner for discussions on new R&D projects and use cases. We will supply our corporate customers with Smell iX16 detector chips in bulk orders as needed in future.
The Smell Inspector Web Site will provide examples and resources for getting up and running with the Smell Inspector.

Mask & shirt
Show your support for our Smell Inspector community! Back €1 ($1.20) to join. Make a €25 ($30) pledge and get an awesome Smell Inspector mouth nose mask! For a 50 € ($60) pledge you will get an ultimate Smell Inspector shirt! We'll get in touch as soon as the campaign ends to let you specify the size you want.
Smell Inspector is a product of the German Startup SmartNanotubes Technologies GmbH. It is a joint effort of a multidisciplinary team of researchers and industry experts with expertise in physics, chemistry, electrical engineering, bioengineering, software development, industrial engineering, marketing and business development in collaboration with the German excellence university TU Dresden and German Life Science Inkubator, who along the years have worked together in several projects sharing the same vision about smell recognition.
From the left: Marcel Händler (M.Sc.), Julius Hickl, Viktor Bezugly (Ph.D.), Birte Sönnichsen (Ph.D.), Vyacheslav Khavrus (Ph.D.), Andreas Werner (M.Sc.)
Whatever happens on the way – we will keep you informed. 
Building a hardware product is hard and we may face unforeseen events that are going to delay us. As we have done in the past on our Facebook and LinkedIn page and our email list, you can count on one thing: we will always keep you updated on our status and potential delays at least one update per month on Kickstarter.

 Technology Evolution
5 generations of detector chips, 3 generations of PCB, 3 versions of software - from research to product
The technology is based on more than 10 years of research at TU Dresden which is a reputable German university. We have produced several kinds of prototypes (detector chips as well as circuit boards) as it can be seen in the pictures above. Currently we are in the middle of the process of producing our first serial sample. To this end we are working together with Turck duotec a renown German EMS company. Current pilot projects are underway at Turck duotec GmbH, the American sensor manufacturer Centaur Analytics Inc. as well as at the German renown technical universities TU Dresden and TU Munich.
Testing the first printed detector chips on foil mounted on the second generation Demo Board in our gas measuring chamber.
The laboratory and measuring equipment has been designed and manufactured in-house and is the result of an intense thinking process and hard working hours in the laboratory.
Preparing the equipment for the in-house production of our nanomaterials. The production and fine-tuning of the nanomaterials for the detector chips Smell iX16 is one  of our key know-hows.
We have intensely analysed different kinds of smells. Using a simplified smell testing setup we could reliably test different gases, VOCs and smells: 
gases and VOCs: ammonia, nitrogen monoxide, phosphine, carbon dioxide, water vapour, ethanol, acetone (and other ketones), isopropanol, toluene, hydrogen peroxide, formaldehyde, 2,6-dimethaxy-phenol, 2-methoxy-4-vinylphenol, guaiacol;
smells: different perfumes, chocolate, wine, vodka, coffee, tee, lemon juice, onion, garlic, banana, orange, potato, meat, fish (also spoiled banana, orange, potato, meat and fish), trash container.
The boards that you see on the pictures are real working prototypes tested by us and our partners. We are 80% ready to have the final product in our hands.
The production will follow these steps:
Components purchase
Warehouse
SMT
AOL
Smell iX16 detector chip production
Quality control for Smell iX16
Complete system assembly
Tests
Quality control packaging
Shipping
Back us now and help us make the Smell Inspector a reality!
The board design is in the final stage and our engineers are checking the electrical schematics and all the components to finalize the PCB development. Nevertheless, the Smell Inspector is not yet ready for the final users, as we still have some tasks regarding  the hardware and software:
validation of Prototype B of the hardware,
production of the test series,
extending Smell Annotator software to Android and iOS,
upscaling the quality control for the Smell iX16 detector chip production,
extending our pre-set data collection to include smells for the most requested community application (stretch goal 1),
setting up and standardizing the digital smell database (stretch goal 2).
Kicking off a big production entails high set-up costs. As a startup company, we can only get it done with your help. Next to building our community this is why you are so important to us: Only if enough supporters back our project by pre-ordering the Smell Inspector, we will have enough funding to produce, assemble and ship the Smell Inspector. With a treshold of €27,800 ($33,760)we would be able to validate prototype B of the Smell Inspector and start the production of the test series. 
If all goes as planned, we will be able to complete production on schedule, ship the Smell Inspector to you in November 2021 and build a worldwide Smell Inspector community.
So – are you ready to become a Smell Inspector yourself?
Spread the word! Encourage friends to become a Smell Inspector, too! 
Thank you for being part of the smell digitization evolution!
The Kickstarter video was produced with support by ravir FILM. For press inquiries please contact Agentur Frische Fische.

Pictures by BLEND3, Katrin Schindler and istockphoto.

We are supported by:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our goal is to provide a ready-to-use product which is compatible with Arduino, Raspberry Pi, Linux, Windows, Android and iOS in order to enable our community to create their own smell-related applications. As we have described in “Where we are at”, before entering serial production, we still have some open issues to solve in the next months. Turck duotec, which is our EMS partner of the project, has over 30 years of experience in customer-specific electronics development and manufacturing. Turck duotec manufacturing unit is a ISO9001 certified company since 2015. We have confirmed with our production partner that the shipping date is realistic. However, there is always a risk for delays in the planned process because of unforeseen circumstances. Of course, we will try our best to avoid those. To keep you informed about everything that's happening, we promise to keep you posted regularly on the progress while your Smell Inspectors are in the making and on their way to you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Something else
Our detector chip Smell iX16 is highly energy efficient. The chip only has a power consumption of 1 μW. Electrical appliances as our Smell Inspector Developer Kit which contain Smell iX16 can thus be operated with reduced energy consumption. This saves resources and conserves the environment. 
Our technology can furthermore be integrated into environmental protection devices that help to keep the air clean, for example.

First we raised your game with Level UP ... NOW we are making game nights even cooler with our new RPG Ice Dice tray! 
As fans of board, card and role-playing games, the team here at Spidermind Games love collecting amazing dice sets, because, let's be honest, you can never have too many dice. 
So we thought, wouldn't it be really cool if there were ice versions of the RPG dice set that could clink around our glasses of whiskey or soda on game nights?! Because who doesn't want ice that are dice!!
Our polypropylene/silicone based four-piece ice tray comes with a built-in water funnel for easy filling. This is a simple solution to the age-old question of “How do I make my ice cubes look like dice?”
The Ice Dice tray will comprise of two materials. The top and bottom outer frames will be solid polypropylene while each individual dice chamber will be made from soft silicone allowing for easy removal of the frozen dice. 
This engineering render shows more clearly the make up of the two materials, however, for the final design, the Polypropylene outer will be white.
Each tray has seven individual chambers which produce a dice shaped ice cube approximately 1 ½ inches in dimeter. Each of the dice contained in the Ice Dice tray are easily recognisable to any RPG player.
 A standard set of polyhedral ice dice has 7 individually shaped dice
  So How Does It Work?
PLAY

We are projecting delivery to begin February 2021, so keep an eye out for news and progress by way of the 'updates' tab, here on the Kickstarter page.
We love reading the comments section but can't always catch each and every question on such a fast-moving space, so if you have a burning question regarding the project, you can message us directly. To get in touch just click on our profile name 'Jon & Oliver', at the top of the page, and then click the 'contact me' button, but do remember to check out the FAQ's as they cover a lot of information about the campaign.
To back us you can click on the button “Back this project” at the top of this page or you can scroll down to select and click on a reward tier. If you are looking to offer support to the campaign without a specific reward, select the "Pledge without a reward" tier at the top and enter your desired pledge amount.
If you wish to claim any available add-ons then increase your pledge amount to cover these as well. You will choose your specific add-on after the end of the campaign, when we send you your backer survey. Just make sure your pledge amount covers the pledge you require and any add-ons you wish. 
Once you have made your selection as to which reward tier you would like, you’ll be prompted to enter your payment details. To complete your pledge, click the “Pledge" button and you’ll be all set! You should receive a confirmation email to confirm that you are now a backer of the project.
Your card will not be charged until the end of the campaign and only if we reach our funding goal.
A few weeks after the end of the campaign you will be sent an email containing a link to a survey where you will be prompted to confirm your pledge level and which specific add-ons you require, enter your postage address and pay for shipping.
Updates on the production process will be posted in the 'updates' section of the campaign page, here on Kickstarter.
Back by popular demand...
Take a Bonus Action and grab a set of glasses in the same move...
The Full Monty
Our 8 Tray Extravaganza

How About Some Cool Add-Ons?
For any of these Add-Ons just increase your pledge by the amount shown. You will confirm your order and choose your reward at the end of the campaign.

The first row is the global shipping rate, based on weight, for a fully tracked service. 
The second row are the tray combinations and the third row the most popular tray and add-on combinations.  For other combinations you will be able to calculate the postage by adding the individual item weights together. 
For weights over 4kg we would have to quote these at time of shipping.
As gamers, we are always on the lookout for that next great idea that will enhance our gaming experience. It was a simple fix made for our Tuesday night RPG session that led to the creation of the Level Up, which was funded through Kickstarter this February raising £886,003 ($1.1m).
Over the next couple of months our 15,760 backers from that project will be receiving their Level Ups and hopefully begin inviting friends around to enjoy game nights again. With Ice Dice we just made those game nights cooler…
This project is promoted by Green Inbox. The tech marketing company behind many successful kickstarter campaigns.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Ice Dice tray has been designed, a prototype produced and tested, and a manufacturer sourced. We are ready to begin the production of the Ice Dice tray, all we need now is you to help us make this concept a real success.

This project has real potential to be massive. That being said, the bigger the project, the more links there are in the chain. With every additional link, there could be additional problems waiting to ambush the smooth planning of this project.

Whilst we hope no problems will occur, IF something was to happen, we can assure you that we will do all we can to mitigate any delay. Some difficulties, however much we might want to help, will be outside of our control. Industrial action, acts of God, fire and flood, ash clouds from volcanoes, global pandemics as well as plague and pestilence are just some of the issues and problems that might occur that we have no control over. 

We have, however, already added in ‘stretch’ room, additional time for each section of the project to be completed and will keep the delivery dates and other deadlines updated on the KS page as well as through our social media channels. We will work hard to ensure all your queries are answered in a timely fashion.

We pride ourselves on being open and honest with all out Kickstarter campaigns. We have chosen a superb team to support us in this project who want Ice Dice to become as much a reality as we do. This being said many of our team are sub-contractors working for several clients at the same time. Sometimes this leads to parts of our production process working slower than we had planned or forecast. If this happens, we will let you, the most important people in this project, know what has happened and what we intend on doing about it.

In essence we commit to keeping our backers updated to any changes or developments when they happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thank you to everyone for waiting so patiently for the completion of the Ice Dice manufacturing run. It was really exciting around a month ago when we received the first samples of the final production run, with all the improvements and upgrades incorporated into it.
Sadly Taiwan, like so much of the rest of the world, has been hit by a surge of Covid cases and I have just been informed that the factory has seen some delays. These delays are due mainly to a mini lockdown that they had and new social distancing procedures they have had to implement in their facility.

updates.update_userinfo: First Look at the Final Tray Design
updates.update_content:
In this update we are excited to be able to bring you a video, demonstrating the final design for the Ice Dice tray.
The video is 8 minutes long and has been filmed at home by Jon, and no he is not expecting to win anything at Cannes this year with his cinematography. What we hope it does do, is show you the final model that you will all be receiving as soon as our container leaves our factory in Taiwan.

Warning, this update contains Dragons!
The Ice Dice trays are still in the manufacturing phase and soon the process will also include the Dragon Ice trays. 
Even during the manufacturing, improvements are being made to the trays composition. By adding a polypropylene / polyethylene mix to the bottom section of the white tray part of the mould, the lid, which is pure polypropylene is now easier to take off once frozen. This means that the lid is under less stress each and every use which will improve the life of each tray significantly.

We hope everyone is keeping well and looking forward to a year of more social interaction (hopefully).
The project is gathering tempo, with manufacturing continuing on the improved version of the Ice Dice tray. For those who missed the first update of this year, the tray now has wider funnels, for quicker filling as well as injection fittings, which allow for more viscous materials such as chocolate to be injected directly into each dice shape.

This notice is relevant to backers who live in mainland Europe.
For anyone who backed our Level Up gaming table, you will already be aware that we have started fulfilling this project, and in the next few weeks we are due to post our first tranche of 3,000 plus packages to our European backers.
We have been asked by many backers whether the new Brexit rules will see the parcels being delivered with nasty customs bills and further charges to pay.
We hope everyone is well and staying safe. We are really excited by this first update of 2021 as it includes a lovely little video from our manufacturers.

To all our backers, here's to a great holiday season and return to normal in 2021.
Current Schedule
This is just a quick update to let everyone know that the first print run from the brand new moulds is expected early in the new year. The factory is now off until after the Chinese New Year but as soon as they are back they have promised us a video of the first Dice Trays coming out of the moulds.

updates.update_userinfo: How can you remain Neutral with this free gift?
updates.update_content:
According to easydamus.com, 'a neutral character does what seems to be a good idea'. In that case here at Spidermind Games we are erring towards the True Neutral.
6 Coasters have just become 9
Having released the six most popular alignments in our glasses and coasters during the Kickstarter campaign, we listened to requests from backers and subsequently released an add-on set of three neutral glasses so people can make up their set of nine. Judging by the numbers from Crowd Ox, it seems almost all of you who bought glasses have extended your collection.
THANK YOU! To all of you for making this wonderful project come to life.

The pledge manager/backer survey generally goes out a week or two after close of the campaign. This is the amount of time Kickstarter takes to collect pledges and transfer the funds to the creators

In short, two weeks to a month is pretty typical, but there's a lot of variation... in fact, there's so much variation that I'd recommend asking individual creators what their planned timeline is... that said, whether they send a survey as soon as the timer hits zero or wait until everything is ready to ship, you should get an e-mail asking you to fill out the survey/pledge manager when it launches.

CrowdOx even lets you add items, pay for what you added, and then add even more... and you can remove items to convert what you've already paid into credit... so, depending on how long it's open for, you could potentially spread the total cost of what you want across several paychecks... or even if it's only open for a relatively short timeframe, you could pay part of your add-ons via a debit card and other via credit card instead of needing a single payment method that can cover the whole cost.

campaign.story:
Petoi Bittle is a tiny but powerful robot that can play tricks like real animals. We fine-tuned every bit to fit agile maneuverability into a palm-sized robot pet. You can bring Bittle to life by assembling its puzzle-like frame and downloading our demo codes on GitHub. You can also teach it new skills to win prizes in our community challenges. Bittle makes a perfect tool for learning, teaching, researching, or a surprising gift to impress your family and friends. Bittle is not a toy for small kids. We recommend parental guidance to appreciate its rich content and avoid damage or injury.
Bittle walking on the desk
Evolving with an open-source gene, Bittle is an open platform to fuse multiple makers' gadgets into one organic system. With our customized Arduino board coordinating all instinctive and sophisticated movements, you can clip on various sensors to bring in perception. You could also inject artificial intelligence capabilities by mounting a Raspberry Pi or other AI chips through wired/wireless connections.
Ball tracking with an intelligent camera mounted on the head
Bittle is the second product of OpenCat, sibling of Nybble. Backed by a worldwide user group, you can find many tutorials and project ideas on the Internet. We make constant but tiny progresses every day. You can follow our social media (Instagram/Twitter @PetoiCamp) to get more frequent updates than newsletters. By posting on our forum, you can contribute to the community or simply make your wishes heard. We are always drawing the blueprint for futuristic robots! 
Self-righting after falling from a slope (triggered by an infrared remote)
Bittle is a palm-sized robot that moves with four legs rather than wheels. Legged motion gives it more freedom to navigate unstructured terrains, and expresses the joy of life whenever it moves. Such dynamic maneuverability was only seen on a few luxury robots from the best labs or tycoon companies previously, such as Boston Dynamics Spot or Sony Aibo. We came up with a grassroots solution to simplify the system to make it affordable and mass-producible.
Walk the dog. Click the image to see a longer clip.
Bittle is a compact system of five major components: body frame, actuator, electronics, battery, and the software to coordinate all the hardware to perform varied tasks. 
Body frame
We designed Bittle's interlocking frame as a 3D puzzle with very few screws involved. Most body parts are symmetric for simplicity and aesthetics.  
Puzzle-like body frame. Click the image for the full assembling animation.
It's a pleasure to assemble and disassemble Bittle for teaching or maintenance. On average, it takes about one hour to put together the body from scratch.
Build a robot dog on your own!
Each piece has gone through tens of iterations with 3D printing. We then use high strength injection-molded plastic to provide the best protection from collision and dust (it's NOT waterproof!). In the stress tests, the assembled robot can take an adult's stepping without breaking any components (do NOT try this at home!).  
Rolling down a step. Click the image for the full review video.
We also designed Bittle to be soft. Besides the elasticity of the material, the spring-loaded upper legs flatten the shock on joint servos to protect their gears. Bittle usually survives regular collisions. In the extreme cases, it will disintegrate at the designated "weak link in the chain", which is easy and cheap to reinstall or replace.
Passive compliant joints
We designed the frame to be compatible with most 9g servos. You could order the "Bittle Shell" perk alone to compile your spare servos into a beautiful action figure!
Actuator
We visited several servo manufacturers and iterated many times to find the optimized parameters. It will be model P1S, a slim, fast servo with a controllable angle of 270 degrees.
P1S servo
We use nine P1S servos to actuate Bittle. Eight of them are for walking joints, and one is for head panning. We will also include one spare servo for replacement, as brushed motors are consumable after a certain period of wearing. You may order the "Bittle Servo Set" perk if you expect to use Bittle intensively for teaching or researching.
Electronics
Bittle is driven by NyBoard V1, a customized Arduino board with rich peripherals. We fully utilized the chip of a regular Arduino Uno to coordinate sophisticated motions. The board can drive at least 12 PWM servos, and an IMU (Inertial Measurement Unit) is used for balancing. It stores "muscle memory" and detects body status (orientation and acceleration) for balancing. We provide an infrared remote to trigger basic movements. The board also listens to string commands from the serial port, such as "walk", "sit", or more detailed instructions for individual joints. 
NyBoardV1

NyBoard V1 is a revision of NyBoard V0 that has been driving 2000 Nybbles all over the world. We continue to provide a 2x5 socket on NyBoard V1 for mounting Raspberry Pi. It powers the Pi and communicates with it through the serial or I2C network. The Pi gives Bittle the ability to analyze more sensory data, get connected to the Internet, and make decisions by itself. Due to Bittle's small size, it best fits Pi Zero and Pi 3A+. For larger Pi models, you will need to tilt the Pi and 3D print some supporting structures. 
Raspberry Pi 3 A+ and Pi camera on Bittle
Thanks to the Arduino and Raspberry Pi community, you can find many customization ideas for Bittle. There are four Seeed Grove sockets on NyBoard V1 for extensible modules. To make installation easier, we designed Bittle's head as a clip to bite on those modules. That explains why we created a dog out of OpenCat this time. We will compile a "sensor pack" perk, including an intelligent camera module, a gesture sensor, a PIR motion sensor, and some other useful sensors. There's also a screw hole inside Bittle's head for fixing additional modules. 
Extensible modules
We developed a Bluetooth dongle for wirelessly uploading codes and controlling Bittle from PC or smartphone Apps. We also developed a WiFi dongle for wirelessly communicating with Bittle. You can play with Bittle without messing around with cables. Wireless is also essential when you are studying balancing related motion planning. You can even utilize the computational power of a remote "brain" without being constrained by Bittle's size and cargo capacity. The dongles are compatible with our previous Nybble model. We will include one extra set for our Nybble backers as a "Thank You" gift. You will need to provide your email and order ID for Nybble in our later survey.  
Bluetooth and WiFi dongles
Furthermore, we are developing an ESP32 development board with native Bluetooth and WiFi connectivity. We have made a functional beta version called the "BiBoard V0" perk for developers. We expect a considerable performance boost, and you are welcome to join our exploration.
BiBoard V0
Software
Bittle is driven by our OpenCat code. It has 3K lines of Arduino codes excluding 3rd party libraries. It defines the minimal data structure and algorithms for performing quadruped motion. We also provide example commander and parser in Python so that you can send instructions from other devices. The code is already running on thousands of small quadruped robots, including many variants of OpenCat.  
The OpenCat codes are open source on Github
You can program Bittle at different levels in various coding environments, such as C in Arduino IDE and Python in the terminal. We are collaborating with TinkerGen, a STEM education company that kindly developed Codecraft (a graphical coding environment) for Bittle. They will also provide a free curriculum for you to learn programming in Codecraft and create a wide array of educational and fun projects with it!
You can code in Arduino IDE, Python, Codecraft, and many other environments
We plan to refactor Bittle's code between the production and release it before Bittle's delivery. You may start to explore the current OpenCat repository on GitHub to get familiar with the framework. We will announce new community challenges with huge prizes in the community section!   
Bittle climbing up a step under realtime instructions sent through Bluetooth
Battery
We designed a Li-ion battery pack with a built-in charging and protection circuit. It can slide into the track underneath Bittle and tune its center of mass. It can power Bittle for at least one hour of continuous walking. It also has an RGB LED to indicate the battery's status.
Li-ion battery with onboard charging and protection circuit
With the slide-in installation mechanism and an anti-reverse plug, it's not too hard to switch batteries. You may order extra batteries for uninterrupted researching or playing. With some reconfiguration, it can also power our previous Nybble models.
You can check this 30-min interview by Hackster.io for all the cool features. 
Bittle is a perfect example to show "small is big". We wanted to encourage people to free their creativity and make wonderful things from limited resources. We have a growing community since the release of the OpenCat demo. We have @petoicamp on social media to update our fans about the progress of the project. After the launch of Nybble, we built the forum on our site (petoi.com) to discuss the project, showcase DIY models, and add function modules. 
Petoi Camp, the OpenCat forum
Looking back at all the challenges we went through, the community was the most significant support that encouraged us to continue. We got thousands of backers to bring Nybble to life. Fans all around the world volunteered to translate our documentation into their languages. And many developers added new features to OpenCat. We cannot wait to see what Bittle will bring to us!  
An Android App (Code&Robots) developed by one of our fans
To make our community more productive, educational, and rewarding, we will launch an online challenge for all OpenCat users. You can find our proposed rules in this forum post and give suggestions before it officially starts. In short, we will define several tasks that can be measured quantitatively, e.g., programing Bittle to get onto the highest step. You have to both demo your solution and teach others to validate your entry. On the first day of each month, we will announce the world's record-breaker and gift a free Bittle or Nybble to the winner!
Who will be the first Bittle backflipper and enter our Hall of Fame?
Bittle standing on my fingers
Bittle is 20cm x 11cm x 11cm in dimension. It weighs less than 280g but can carry up to 450g cargo under its belly. With proper programming and calibration, It can run faster than two body lengths per second. Bittle can remember tens of instinctive motion patterns and can perform more fancy tricks with realtime instructions. 
Bittle (250g) trotting with an iron cargo (465g)
P1S servo uses a coreless motor, alloy gears, ball bearing, and plastic case. It's 8.4V compatible, high speed, and has a controllable range of 270 degrees.  
Bittle on a treadmill
NyBoard V1 has an Atmega328P with 16MHz CPU, 2K SRAM, and 32K flash. We also added an 8K I2C EEPROM, an IMU, a servo driver for 12 PWM servos, an infrared receiver, and a buzzer. It has a 2x5 socked to mount on a Raspberry Pi. 
BiBoard V0 has an ESP32 with 240MHz dual-core CPU, 520KB SRAM, and up to 16M flash. It has built-in WiFi/Bluetooth, 12 PWM servo pins, an IMU, an infrared receiver, an audio amplifier, and a speaker. It has several communication ports to connect to other devices.  
The Bluetooth dongle is compatible with Windows, macOS, and Android. It can also work on IOS with some auxiliary software. It can be used for uploading Arduino sketch or communicating with the NyBoard. The WiFi module can host a simple WebUI and communicate with the NyBoard. 
BiBoard V0, NyBoard V1 with Raspberry Pi 3 A+, and NyBoard V1 with a Bluetooth dongle
The intelligent camera module is our ODMed product. It integrates multiple vision recognition algorithms running on its ESP32 dual-core processor. It can return recognized human body, objects, and symbols through serial/I2C/WiFi at a rate of 25fps or 50fps. It can even stream video through WiFi. We will also include a deck of symbol cards. You can refer to this link for more information.
Intelligent camera module and the symbol deck
We compiled the sensor pack with Seeed studios' Grove modules. You can refer to this link for more information. 
We have been residing in the factory for six months and commit to staying until we start to ship Bittles.    
Spark Erosion Machining (EDM) for making precise molds
We have finished 95% percent of the injection molds of the body frame. The lead time for injection production is one week. More funds are required to make the mold for the optional silicone tail and paws. The lead time is one month. We will provide their 3D printing files if they cannot catch up in time. We are still optimizing the parameters of servos for longer life-span. The lead time is at least two months. NyBoard V1 and battery are production-ready, and the suppliers are waiting for down payments for mass production. The lead time is 45 days to 50 days. We also need to design a sturdy and compact packaging box for international shipping. The lead time is one month. 
Production schedule
OpenCat started as the founder Rz Li's pet project in 2016. After the demo video went viral in 2018, he devoted all his time and resources to bring this sophisticated and cute robot to the public. He founded Petoi and successfully crowdfunded the Nybble project in 2018. All the earnings have been put into the fulfillment of Nybble and the R&D of Bittle.
We are still fulfilling Nybble orders for a worldwide audience
Our mission is to bring affordable robotic pets from fiction to reality. We grew from a single maker to a company that can collaborate and negotiate with manufacturers to get the best solutions to our needs. We have many more cool ideas in mind, and Bittle is another small step towards our ideal shape of household robots.
Nybble and Bittle
You can help to bring this project to life by backing a wide selection of perks. The main perk for this campaign is the Bittle kit, available from $195 for early bird backers. We will include a free set of wireless dongles for our former Nybble backers.
Bittle kit (the final contents are subject to change)
Because there's no shopping cart on Kickstarter to combine your orders, you can refer to the following tables and compare their contents. Pick your base perk, then add the price of your add-on items to your pledge amount during checkout. You will also need to pay the shipping of your base perk during checkout. The extra shipping cost will be covered by us! Make sure you take note of what you ordered! 
Table of perks
You can decide your base(composite) perk from the following table, then add extra items according to your needs. 
Contents of composite perks
You will also need to provide your account ID and payment method to secure your pledge. Kickstarter campaign is an "all or nothing" game. Your credit card will only be charged if we can meet the campaign goal during the period. You will receive a survey for your shipping address and other information, such as your preferred color, add-on items, and your Nybble backer ID. 
We will ship your packages from our Chinese factory with reliable international couriers. Your government will collect the customs tax/fees upon delivery. Note: It can be expensive for some countries and areas. We are very grateful for your support and hope to bring you a unique product ASAP!
It has been a fantastic launch! With only a short notice of prelaunch, our initial goal of $50,000 was fulfilled within one day! It is a historical moment for me, for Petoi, and for everyone who loves robotics!
A brief celebration on the factory's roof
Reaching the original funding goal will help us continue finalizing the R & D of Bittle. We just paid for the mold of silicone tail and paws, and will include them as standard components in the Bittle kit. But we need more funds to pay retainage, prepare for the inventory, break-even, and pay ourselves.
Body language of "excitement"
Please shout out to your friends and network that we are setting a STRETCH GOAL at $200,000.  If we meet our stretch goal, we will gift one Grove module in the Bittle kit (even if you didn't back the sensor pack) to encourage you to utilize Bittle's extensible features. Of course, the module should not overlap with the sensor pack. You can browse this list and tell us your favorite. We will pick the most popular one. 
Kickstarter is an open platform that reaches different kinds of people with varying interests. Bittle is an open platform to help people realize many dreams in robotics. We have a perfect match in user groups, and the resonance can make our ideas better heard by the world. We are highly interested in your feedback on the design, and how you will train and hack Bittle.
We also need your help! We focus so much on Bittle's deliverables that we barely have the budget for ads and marketing. We need your voice to spread out the news to reach more people. The more orders we get, the more leverages we have to negotiate with suppliers for the best quality and production priority. The more users we have, the more fun you get when everyone pitches in and builds applications upon Bittle.
  Dr. Rongzhong Li (Rz)
Founder and CEO 
Rz is a physics PhD and computer science master. He previously taught computer science at Wake Forest University.
Rz is a maker with broad interests in art, literature, and science. He started the OpenCat project in 2016 and successfully launched Nybble in 2018. Devoted to bringing robotic pets to more people, Bittle is his second gift to the world.
 Lingqing Pi (Len)
System Engineer 
Len has a master's degree in computer communication systems. He has been running various STEM camps over the past five years.
Len likes to try out new electronic products and excels in remembering their parameters. He designed the variant PCBs and communication modules to make Bittle more extensible and user friendly.
 Kai Mai
Advisor 
Kai is an alumnus of UC Berkeley and Carnegie Mellon University(CMU). He served as the chapter president of Berkeley & CMU alumni network in Shanghai and is the co-president of the Berkeley Chinese Alumni International Association, Silicon Valley Chapter.  He was the VP of Engineering for ALO7, a leading English language learning education technology company in China.
Kai has rich experiences and expertise in startup bootstrapping/fundraising/scaling and project/product/engineering management.  He helps supervise Petoi's management and development.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Hardware products are especially "hard" to deliver compared to pure software products. After two years of experience with Nybble, we foresee the following risks and are working hard to mitigate them. 
 
* Supply chain, cash flow, and inventory management
Any delay in the supply chain could halt production at any stage. We try to solve this by carefully estimating the lead time and divide sequential dependency into parallel processes, and moving the most challenging tasks to our top priority. 
 
Now we need the final push to finalize the designs and make down payments to kick off mass production. However, Kickstarter funding is an "all or nothing" game, and the funds will only arrive weeks after the campaign. So we lowered the funding goal a bit to negotiate with our manufacturer earlier during the campaign. They can start to prepare the materials earlier, given our crowdfunding progress. 

This time we include batteries to avoid users' confusion in picking the right ones. However, the production for 2S Li-ion batteries requires an MOQ of 5000 units. It's a sizeable one-time investment, and the storage of many batteries is also risky. We will rent a dedicated room to store the batteries. We will also optimize the production process to reduce the lagging period between stocking and shipping the batteries. 

* Certificates and international shipping 
Bittle needs to go through several standard tests for importing and exporting certifications. The tests may take up to two months after we send the final products. We took the advice from our experienced manufacturers that the specifications should not be too exceptional. We will reserve Bittle's full dynamic potential to make it a more stable product. 

The breakout of COVID-19 is adding another layer of uncertainty for production and shipping. The factories are subject to close should any case was reported in the area. The international couriers are also having a hard time arranging oversea shipments. There may be a longer wait time between our shipping date and the delivery on your side. 
 
We will ship Bittles worldwide through international couriers that can provide reliable tracking. Backers will be responsible for paying customs and duties. The amount varies by country or region. We may have a few customers canceling their orders if the fees upon delivery are too high. So we want to make sure everyone knows about the shipping policy before they order. 

* Team development
We currently have two people working full-time on the project. We managed to push it to the current stage and will scale up the team in time for the massive amount of work towards fulfilling your orders.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Sustainable Distribution
We will combine orders and use compact packages to save shipping space and fuel.

support.title: Contribute a bittle to open source
support.descp:
Every open source project has to struggle to find a way to survive, especially when they have hardware products to deliver. Peek into our discussion around the OpenCat project and see how we figure out all the challenges from idea development to fulfilling orders.
INCLUDES:
Subscription to our community newsletters

support.title: Wireless Dongles
support.descp:
We made a Bluetooth and a WiFi dongle for wirelessly uploading codes and controlling Bittle from PC or smartphone Apps.
* For our previous backers of Nybble, we will gift an additional set! You will need to provide your email address and backer ID for Nybble in our later survey.
INCLUDES:
Bluetooth and WiFi dongles

support.title: Bittle Shell
support.descp:
Enjoy our precisely injection-molded Bittle frame with a frosted matte finish. It's designed to be a 3D puzzle and is compatible with most 9g servos. You can configure your own robot or just make an action figure with some cheaper servos.
INCLUDES:
Plastic body parts

support.title: Bittle Battery
support.descp:
Get our rechargeable 1000mAh (5C) 7.4V Li-ion battery pack for Bittle! Inside a sturdy case, It also includes a charging and protection circuit. You can charge it with a 5V USB to micro-USB cable.
* With a few DIY modifications, it's also compatible with our previous Nybble robot.
INCLUDES:
Rechargeable 7.4V Li-ion battery pack

support.title: NyBoard V1
support.descp:
With NyBoard, an Arduino compatible motion controller, you can design whatever animal or creature you like. Learn from OpenCat, connect the board, and create your own robot pets!
INCLUDES:
NyBoard V1

support.title: BiBoard V0
support.descp:
This ESP32 based development board brings native wireless connectivity to Bittle. We will provide basic Arduino compatible codes to drive Bittle and leave more resources and possibilities for your creativity. Let's work on it together!
* This board is relatively independent of other perks and has to pass additional certificates for its wireless components. The estimated delivery will be later than other perks.
INCLUDES:
BiBoard V0

support.title: Intelligent Camera Module
support.descp:
This intelligent camera module integrates multiple vision recognition algorithms running on its ESP32 dual-core processor. It can help Bittle recognized the human body, objects, and symbols. We will also include a deck of symbol cards.
INCLUDES:
Intelligent camera module

support.title: Sensor Pack
support.descp:
Add this sensor pack to give Bittle perception about its surroundings. You will get an intelligent camera module, a gesture sensor, a PIR motion sensor, and some other useful sensors. All can be wired conveniently to NyBoard V1 through Seeed Grove connectors.
INCLUDES:
Intelligent camera module
Gesture sensor
Passive infrared motion sensor
Light sensor
Sound sensor (noise level detector)
Infrared distance sensor
Touch sensor

support.title: Bittle Servo Set
support.descp:
Slim servo motors with fast and precise actuation to meet the high requirements of legged robots. You will need more if you expect to use Bittle intensively for teaching or researching. We include 12 servos in this set so that you can get timely replacements or add more joints to your robot.
INCLUDES:
12× P1S Servo

support.title: Bittle Kit (Early Bird)
support.descp:
Ever imagined to own a dynamic and programmable robot dog to play with? Bittle is right designed for you! By fine-tuning every bit, we are able to zip Bittle into one compact kit you can build!

* Limited units are available for early adopters!
INCLUDES:
Plastic body parts
10× P1S Servo
Rechargeable 7.4V Li-ion battery pack
NyBoard V1
Bluetooth and WiFi dongles

support.title: Bittle Kit (Kickstarter special)
support.descp:
Includes everything you need to make the robot dog up and running! You can get Bittle at a discounted price during our Kickstarter campaign. Hurry up! The price will go up after the campaign!
INCLUDES:
Plastic body parts
10× P1S Servo
Rechargeable 7.4V Li-ion battery pack
NyBoard V1
Bluetooth and WiFi dongles

support.title: Bittle Research Pack
support.descp:
Whether you are a hardcore engineer, maker, student, or just want to get your hands on a quadruped robot, you can take this research package as a starting point.

The sensor pack brings high-level perception to Bittle. The WiFi/Bluetooth modules make coding and debugging wireless. The spare servos give you the confidence to develop some acrobatic tricks. And an extra battery makes your playtime uninterrupted.
INCLUDES:
Plastic body parts
20× P1S Servo
NyBoard V1
2× Rechargeable 7.4V Li-ion battery pack
Sensor pack
Bluetooth and WiFi dongles

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
It’s almost halfway through 2021. How time flies! We have shipped 500 Kickstarter orders and 100 Indiegogo orders since the last update. Now we have only 70 orders left to send. They are either due to late survey completion or include some Nybble replacements for the repeat backers. We expect to ship them within this week to proceed to the next stage of our project. If you haven’t received your Bittle for specific reasons, please write to support@petoi.com.

Dear Backers,
It's my anniversary living in the factory, half a year after the production started. I feel a little frustrated because the stay was much longer than I expected. I didn't know the industrial zone is no longer attractive to hire young talents. I didn't know a professional factory could also make naive mistakes. I didn't foresee the worldwide chip crisis and didn't expect a few cheap sensors would be the bottleneck of our fulfillment. We set up the campaign well but are trapped in an infinite loop of asking our suppliers and apologizing to customers. I hope to break out this loop by shipping all the backorders ASAP.

updates.update_userinfo: New demos, and the solution to delayed supplies
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
After the two-week-long Chinese New Year holiday, most of the factories have resumed regular operation. We have been working hard and sent out 1500 Bittles, which are more than half of the existing orders.

Dear Backers,
Another busy month has passed. I understand how anxious waiting is because I'm also a buyer for our supplies. In this update, I will share you with full details about the current shipping progress, what we've been going through, and how we are trying to accelerate the process.

updates.update_userinfo: Missing pieces, and the shipping schedule
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
I'm a little anxious on the last night of 2020, waiting for the last pieces of Bittles. The good news is that we are very close to shipping them! I'm sharing the details about our schedule to get your orders delivered as soon as possible.
We have finished assembling 1750 sets of Bittle bodies and 600 sets of Bittle legs. For unassembled kits, we have sorted all the color themes into separate plates.

updates.update_userinfo: The busiest month for Bittle hatching
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers, 
Happy holidays! Here are some updates on our production for Bittle. 
We have stocked 4000 sets of Bittle shells and 3000 batteries on our shelves. 3000 sets of NyBoards and wireless modules are still at the PCBA factory and should arrive on Dec.15th. We have finalized the design of the internal and external boxes for the Bittle kit, and will produce 5000 sets next week. The servos are a little behind schedule. We have made 30000 sets of servo cases, and they are sent to another factory to print our logo. Their micro-controllers and the gears are ready. But the motors will only start to arrive on Dec. 8th. Then we will put all the pieces into functional servos. There are 1000 sets of intelligent cameras and sensor packs in production. They will be added during the final packaging.

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys, production status, and fighting scammers
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
As 2020 steps into November, we are also making significant progress toward the fulfillment. Though I planned to push an update with more milestones, I decided to post today to warn you of a scam page appeared this week.
Warning

Dear Backers,
We are thrilled to announce that our Bittle campaign was successfully funded! The performance was extraordinary by every measure. Thanks for supporting us in making this fantastic campaign! This update will highlight some campaign stats and prepare you for the coming production and delivery process.

Dear Backers,
It is a quick update that we just got 1827 backers to reach $500K. That's 10x of our original funding goal! I want to say "Thank you" to all followers and backers who helped bring this project to life.
